column6: Smallest viruses replicating autonomously in eukaryotic cells.[43]
Often used as a vector for the cloning of recombinant DNA.
Until 2013 the largest known viral genome.[51]
First genome of a living organism sequenced July 1995[55]
First genome of a bryophyte sequenced January 2008.[70]
First multicellular animal genome sequenced December 1998[75]
Size variation based on strain (175-180Mb; standard y w strain is 175Mb)[76]
Homo sapiens estimated genome size 3.2 billion bp[81]

Organism type: Initial sequencing and analysis of the human genome[82]

column6: Bonobo -  estimated genome size 3.29 billion bp[83]
Smallest vertebrate genome known estimated to be 340 Mb[85][86] – 385 Mb.[87]
